derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (originally denoting a non-ecclesiastical council): from Anglo-Norman French consistorie, from late Latin consistorium, from consistere 'stand firm' (see consist)

means.word_mean: 1. a church tribunal or governing body

auth_sentence.content: That opinion was echoed by Stephan Kramer, general secretary of the Central Consistory of Jews in Germany.
